messages.subject: on topic discussions ...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Tiffany ... I agree w/ Robin, you ll find that unschooling fms are interested in SO MANY THINGS in this life, so really, *anything* goes on this list; potty
messages.messageBody:
Hi Tiffany ...

I agree w/ Robin, you'll find that unschooling fms are interested in SO MANY
THINGS in this life, so really, *anything* goes on this list; potty
training, pros/cons of spanking and daycare, you name it, it's been
discussed :)

honestly, b-f'ing posts brought back such great memories ... my older dch
are grown and on their own and my younger boys (12/10) are well beyond the
bottle stage (they were bottle babies b/c we adopted and I didn't have
enough time to prepare or believe me, I WOULD HAVE!!! SNIFF :::::::) ...
the post about snuggling by the Christmas lights REALLY got to me and also
the one about being KICKED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT by tiny toes;
SNIFFFFFFFFFfffffff!!! oh what precious memories I have of my precious
babies; b-f/bottle ...

you *do* have a valid point though, Tiffany ... *sometimes* things discussed
on this list, or any other, don't interest us *personally* but might be
useful for someone else ... trust me, if you give us time and hang around
long enough something'll *snag* ya b/c this list talks about EVERYTHING
under the sun <G>.

happy day everyone ...
Pris ~> back to lurking under her rock, shoot it's such a pretty day in TX I
just MIGHT come out and sit ON MY ROCK :)

~*~*~*~*~
We can do anything we want as long as we stick to it long enough. -Helen
Keller



----- Original Message -----
From: "DiamondAir" <diamondair@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 19, 2000 11:07 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: nursing


> > From: Bob & Tiffany <bobntiff@...>
> >
> > I am new here. Please don't take offense, but isn't this an
> unschooling
> > list??? I have not seen a post yet that had to do with unschooling.
>
> I don't know. Unschooling to me means learning from life, that there is no
> clear delineating between "schooling" and "learning", that learning can
> happen anywhere and everywhere. Every post on this list is about life and
> learning, and although some of the topics will not appeal to each of us,
> I've found that overall there is much to be learned from the wisdom on
this
> list.
>
